channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for WA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for WA

item.title: Report X-2024030607
item.description:
Report X-2024030607

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-21T15:13:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-14
  • City: SPOKANE
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On 3/14/2024 at approximately 2158, Dangerous Goods Administation received a call from Employee 240946 at a station location in Spokane, reporting an undeclared deisel spill. The shipment consists of what appears to be a diesel fuel pump containing fuel residue. The shipment was discovered leaking during sort. The package was not prepared in accordance with IATA Regulations, being void of the required markings, labeling, packaging, and paperwork. The shipment is being held, pending an FAA investigation.

item.title: Report X-2024030667
item.description:
Report X-2024030667

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-21T15:13:33+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-13
  • City: TUKWILA
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: PLASTIC JERRICAN WAS DISCOVERED BY AN AUDITOR WHO THEN NOTIFIED A RESPONDER. ALL PPE (GLOVES, GOGGLES, BOOTS, APRON, SILVER LINING) WAS PUT ON AND JERRICAN WAS PLACED INTO A YELLOW TUB/DMP BAG. JERRICAN WAS THEN TRANSFERRED TO THE DMP FOR FURTHER PROCESSING. ALL TUBS/PPE WERE THEN DECONTAMINATED AND JERRICAN WAS FURTHER PROCESSED INTO ETT.

item.title: Report X-2024030645
item.description:
Report X-2024030645

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-20T15:11:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-03-12
  • City: REDMOND
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: RESPONDER RESPONDED TO A LEAKING PACKAGE. OUTER BOX IS MARKED WITH ARROWS, FRAGILE, AND STICKER:" CONTAINS ISOPROPYL ALCOHOL". JUG INSIDE IS ONE GALLON OF 99% ISOPROPYL ALCOHOL. LOOSE LOCKING CAP, LIQUID LEAKING OUT.

Report X-2024030489

  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: As the package was being unloaded the package handler noticed a white residue coming out of the bottom. DescribePack: Loose cap DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Once the package was discovered the box was set inside a hazmat tote, taken to the damaged hazmat cage, and set under the vent.

  • Description: RESPONDER ARRIVED AT WORK TO SEE A PACKAGE IN A SPILL TUB ON THE RESPONDER DESK. LOOKING AT THE PACKAGE RESPONDER NOTICED THE DIAMOND HAZARD LABEL. DONNING PPE RESPONDER THEN PROCESSED THE LEAKING PACKAGE.

item.title: Report X-2024030272
item.description:
Report X-2024030272

Identified by scraper @ 2024-03-15T15:11:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-02-28
  • City: BURLINGTON
  • State: WA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was unloaded from trailer then brought to QA when it was noticed box was damp, box was placed in red hazmat tote DescribePack: Cap is loose causing liquid to spill from top DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed in red hazmat tote and isolated from other boxes to reduce spillage
